intro: Aloe arborescens subsp. arborescens, commonly known as the torch aloe, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It features a branched stem with fleshy, triangular leaves that are typically green with red or orange margins. The plant produces showy, orange-red inflorescences that resemble torches, blooming in summer. It is drought-tolerant and thrives in full sun, making it suitable for xeriscaping. Its leaves contain a gel that has been used for its soothing properties in traditional medicine.
